sentences.sContent: He was a rebel who bucked the system (=  opposed rules or authority  ) .
sentences.sCn: 他是一个反抗体制的叛逆者。

sentences.sContent: Unemployment in the area has bucked the trend by falling over the last month.
sentences.sCn: 这个地区的失业现象已经有所逆转，最近一个月来失业率下降了。

synos.tran: （美）钱，元；雄鹿；纨绔子弟；年轻的印第安人或黑人

phrases.pCn: 使振作；打起精神；[俚]加快
n. 轻易得来的钱；投机赚钱

trans.tranOther: to oppose something in a direct way
a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar
